title: React
description: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

chapters.title: Introduction
chapters.details: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It is maintained by Facebook and a community of individual developers and companies. React can be used as a base in the development of single-page or mobile applications. However, React is only concerned with rendering data to the DOM, and so creating React applications usually requires the use of additional libraries for state management and routing. Redux and React Router are respective examples of such libraries.

chapters.title: JSX
chapters.details: JSX is a syntax extension to JavaScript. It is similar to a template language, but it has full power of JavaScript. JSX gets compiled to React.createElement() calls which return plain JavaScript objects called 'React elements'. These objects are then used to build the DOM.

chapters.title: Components
chapters.details: Components let you split the UI into independent, reusable pieces, and think about each piece in isolation. Conceptually, components are like JavaScript functions. They accept arbitrary inputs (called 'props') and return React elements describing what should appear on the screen.

chapters.title: Props
chapters.details: Props are a way of passing data from parent to child. They are immutable and are passed from parent to child via attributes.

chapters.title: State
chapters.details: State is similar to props, but it is private and fully controlled by the component.

chapters.title: Lifecycle
chapters.details: Each component has several “lifecycle methods” that you can override to run code at particular times in the process. Methods prefixed with will are called right before something happens, and methods prefixed with did are called right after something happens.

chapters.title: Handling Events
chapters.details: Handling events with React elements is very similar to handling events on DOM elements. There are some syntax differences:

chapters.title: Conditional Rendering
chapters.details: In React, you can create distinct components that encapsulate behavior you need. Then, you can render only some of them, depending on the state of your application.

chapters.title: Lists and Keys
chapters.details: You can build collections of elements and include them in JSX using curly braces {}.

title: Node
description: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform, back-end JavaScript runtime environment .

chapters.title: Introduction
chapters.details: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform, back-end JavaScript runtime environment that runs on the V8 engine and executes JavaScript code outside a web browser.

chapters.title: NPM
chapters.details: NPM is a package manager for the JavaScript programming language. It is the default package manager for the JavaScript runtime environment Node.js.

chapters.title: Modules
chapters.details: Modules are the basic building blocks in Node.js. Each file in Node.js application is considered as a Module. It has its own scope, so it does not interfere with other modules or pollute global scope.

chapters.title: HTTP
chapters.details: The HTTP module can create an HTTP server that listens to server ports and gives a response back to the client.

chapters.title: Express
chapters.details: Express is a minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework that provides a robust set of features for web and mobile applications.

chapters.title: MongoDB
chapters.details: MongoDB is a cross-platform document-oriented database program. Classified as a NoSQL database program, MongoDB uses JSON-like documents with optional schemas.

chapters.title: Mongoose
chapters.details: Mongoose is a MongoDB object modeling tool designed to work in an asynchronous environment. Mongoose supports both promises and callbacks.

title: Data Structures and Algorithms
description: Data Structures and Algorithms (DSA) is a fundamental concept in computer science. It involves the study of organizing and managing data and solving complex problems through efficient algorithms.

chapters.title: Introduction
chapters.description: Introduction to Data Structures and Algorithms
chapters.details: Overview of basic concepts in data structures and algorithms.

chapters.title: Arrays
chapters.details: Study of arrays, their properties, and various algorithms related to arrays.

chapters.title: Recursion
chapters.details: Understanding recursion and recursive algorithms.

chapters.title: Dynamic Programming
chapters.details: Exploring dynamic programming techniques and algorithms.

chapters.title: Strings
chapters.details: Manipulating and processing strings using algorithms.

chapters.title: Mathematics
chapters.details: Mathematical algorithms and computations in data structures.

chapters.title: Greedy Algorithms
chapters.details: Study of greedy algorithms and their applications.

chapters.title: Depth-First Search (DFS)
chapters.details: Depth-first search algorithms for graph traversal.

chapters.title: Trees
chapters.details: Understanding tree data structures and related algorithms.

title: SQL
description: SQL is a standard language for storing, manipulating and retrieving data in databases.

chapters.title: Introduction
chapters.details: SQL is a standard language for storing, manipulating and retrieving data in databases.

chapters.title: SQL Syntax
chapters.details: SQL is a standard language for storing, manipulating and retrieving data in databases.

chapters.title: SQL SELECT Statement
chapters.details: The SELECT statement is used to select data from a database.

chapters.title: SQL SELECT DISTINCT Statement
chapters.details: The SELECT DISTINCT statement is used to return only distinct (different) values.

chapters.title: SQL WHERE Clause
chapters.details: The WHERE clause is used to filter records.

chapters.title: SQL AND, OR and NOT Operators
chapters.description: SQL AND, OR and NOT Operators
chapters.details: The AND, OR, and NOT operators are used to filter records based on more than one condition.

chapters.title: SQL ORDER BY Keyword
chapters.details: The ORDER BY keyword is used to sort the result-set in ascending or descending order.

chapters.title: SQL INSERT INTO Statement
chapters.details: The INSERT INTO statement is used to insert new records in a table.

chapters.title: SQL UPDATE Statement
chapters.details: The UPDATE statement is used to modify the existing records in a table.

chapters.title: SQL DELETE Statement
chapters.details: The DELETE statement is used to delete existing records in a table.
